page.title: 16A Seaton Burn School Outing
page.content: For our trip to{Beamish}we paid Â£46-50 for 39 children and six adults to enter the Museum.The cost of the coach was Â£32-50.We left school at 9.30am.We got there at 10.00am. There was a fair which had a coconut shy 20p for three balls, Shuggy boats 20p per person, flying chairs 20p and horses 20p. Then we had a picnic lunch on the grass. I had egg and tomato sandwiches,an aero bar of chocolate and a drink of fruit juice, crisps and a trifle.In the town there are old shops, there are horses and carts which cost 30p a ride. There is a tramcar line that leads out of the town to the Transport Collection. We had a ride for 15p. Nearby are pit cottages. There is an old drift mine where the miners worked, it was 10p to go into the mine. We visited the shop, then left Beamish, my family was dropped off at the Travellers Rest.
